posts.post_content: Hi Everyone!   I am starting to think SGC grading is more accurate than PSA. Since I am new to collecting, I am curious what you, the experts think. Everyone is welcome to comment, as I think this will benefit us all. Looking forward to what everyone has to say. Also, PSA has a good population report, but I am struggling to find where SGC reports on cards. Any help is appreciated, and ALL FEEDBACK IS WELCOME!!!!

I say always buy the card not the holder, but having said that, PSA is much preferred and has a higher re sale value.  If you see a great card in a SGC holder and you want it- grab it.  If you're doing this strictly for money, purchase PSA cards.

There's no such thing as "accurate". Accurate to what? It's totally subjective and relative. I think the only word that really can apply is consistent. And to me SGC is more consistent in their grading. That said, I'll still buy a nice looking PSA card. Just buy the card, not the grade.

[quote name="Bobbycee" post=2035769]I say always buy the card not the holder, but having said that, PSA is much preferred and has a higher re sale value.  If you see a great card in a SGC holder and you want it- grab it.  If you're doing this strictly for money, purchase PSA cards.[/QUOTE]

+1.  A big fan of buying what you like.

Probably better to be on the general thread versus B/S/T but I think you can find examples of each which look better/worse for the grade in any of the grading companies.  That said, add another +1 to the buy the card versus the slab.
I was curious.  Just got a Johnny Evers Chicago Jersey graded SGC 80/6 that looks amazing, for quite the deal.  It looks to me to be in better condition that a PSA 6 I am looking at on EBay.
This is selling thread place only as Rambo  stated ... still show your card
If anyone wants to make an offer, please feel free to contact me. No lowballing please.
Man, I love my cards raw tho
